course_title: Roles & Opportunities for Contemporary Speech Pathology

learning_outcomes.description: Describe the roles and ethical responsibilities of a speech pathologist in an evolving profession (SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1 1.7, 2.1 2.7, 3.1 3.6).
Describe the application of current and evolving technologies in speech pathology practice (SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.1 1.3, 1.5, 1.7, 2.6, 3.2, 3.4 and 3.5).
Communicate the knowledge, skills and attributes of a speech pathologist in preparation for future job opportunities (SPA PS Domains/Standards 2.5, 2.6, 2.7, 3.6).
Apply an entrepreneurial mindset to identify novel contributions to speech pathology practice.
Work effectively in professional teams (SPA PS Domains/Standards 1.4, 2.3, 2.5, 2.6, 3.1, 3.3, 3.4).

assessments.assessment_title: Employability Part A: Job Application Package
assessments.task_description:
This assessment requires students to demonstrate understanding of the application process for a speech pathology role by preparing a professional application package. 

Students will respond to one (1) of three (3) job advertisements by writing a cover letter, resume, and answering the selection criteria as specified in the advertisement. Students will also provide a mock LinkedIn profile that will be viewed by your prospective employer as part of the application process. A detailed task description and rubric will be provided on the SPCH7214 Blackboard site. 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit one (1) electronic copy via the SPCH7214 Blackboard site, attaching a signed SHRS coversheet.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Integrating Technology into Future Practice Video Assignment
assessments.task_description:
The goal of this assignment is to encourage students to critically reflect on the role of technology in clinical settings and develop strategies for effectively integrating technological tools into their future practice.

Students will create a 5-6 minute video presentation outlining how they plan to incorporate technology into their clinical work as a future speech-language pathologist. Students may use slides, screen recordings, and/or visual aids to enhance their presentation. 

A detailed task description and rubric will be provided on the SPCH7214 Blackboard site. 

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submit the video in a commonly supported format via the relevant Blackboard assessment link. A copy of your script for this presentation should be uploaded as a separate file to the same Blackboard submission portal.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Future of Speech Pathology Group Presentation
assessments.due_date:
25/05/2026 - 26/05/2026

All groups must submit their Clinical Bite session plan and associated multimedia via Blackboard by 1pm on Monday 25th May. Groups should nominate one (1) group member to submit the required materials. Presentations will take place during students' timetabled tutorial sessions in Week 13 of semester. Attendance is expected at all presentations.

If a student is unable to attend a tutorial due to medical or other valid reasons, the group is still expected to complete the task collectively during the tutorial and receive a group mark. The student who is absent should contact the course coordinator (a.angwin@uq.edu.au) as soon as possible to register their absence and provide supporting evidence (e.g., medical certificate).
assessments.task_description:
Students will work in groups of 4-5 to present a 20-minute Clinical Bite on "The Future of Speech Pathology". Each group will need to develop a persuasive, innovative, and engaging learning activity to inform the audience of how they perceive the future of speech pathology practice to look in a specific context. Each group will be allocated a different context to consider in their presentation. 

A detailed task description and rubric will be provided on the SPCH7214 Blackboard site. Students will be marked on both the quality and content of their presentation (20%) and a peer assessment on teamwork (5%).

Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT) are emerging tools that may support students in completing this assessment task. Students may appropriately use AI and/or MT in completing this assessment task. Students must clearly reference any use of AI or MT in each instance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1 (Assessment Procedure (95)).
assessments.submission_guidelines: One (1) group member should submit the group's Clinical Bite session plan and associated multimedia through the Blackboard submission link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Employability Part B: Individual job interview
assessments.due_date: The interviews will be scheduled during the End of Semester Exam Period
assessments.task_description:
Students will participate in a 15-minute individual job interview online via Zoom. Students will be interviewed for the same new graduate speech pathology position as per their submission for Employability Part A.

A detailed task description and rubric will be provided on the SPCH7214 Blackboard site. When a student is required to complete an oral or practical assessment item worth 20% or more, the performance will be recorded and retained per Appendix 1 (Assessment Procedure (95) ).

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of Generative AI may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 7 To Week 12(13 Apr - 24 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Self-Directed Learning

Students are required to access weekly content via Blackboard and complete the necessary learning activities prior to each tutorial. Content includes in depth exploration of roles and opportunities in different speech pathology contexts, factors impacting the profession both now and in the future (e.g., telepractice, technology and AI), and applying for jobs in speech pathology.

learning_activities.topic:
Lecture

Representatives from QLD Health and the Department of Education will present on working in and applying for jobs in these sectors.
learning_activities.topic_description: Lecture Representatives from QLD Health and the Department of Education will present on working in and applying for jobs in these sectors.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 8 To Week 12(20 Apr - 24 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

Students are required to attend two (2) tutorial sessions each week from Week 8 to Week 12. Each tutorial will be 2 hours in duration. These tutorials will focus on discussion and problem-solving specific to weekly content.
